a stick having at one end a mass of thick, cloth strings or a sponge (= soft substance) that you slide along a floor to spread or absorb a liquid in cleaning the floor
A mop of hair is a lot of hair in a thick mass: The child’s face was framed by a mop of brown curls.
If you mop the sweat (= liquid produced because you are hot) from your face, you use your hand or a piece of cloth to remove it. Phrasal verb
mop up (something)
